message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper discusses automatic discourse segmentation, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). The use of marker lists and POS labeling suggests a focus on computational linguistics (cs.CL) and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the evaluation of the segmentation models against a manually annotated corpus involves the use of metrics and statistical analysis, which are common in artificial intelligence (cs.AI), information retrieval (cs.IR), and neural networks (cs.NE).
